Comments_List: I learned a lot about how organisms answer fundamental questions at the evolutionary scale about how to shape their lives, while developing stronger scientific writing and reasoning skills.

The structure of the course is, in my opinion, incredibly well designed to promote student learning.  The questions assigned to be answered before each class demanded careful thought, and were far from just simple reading checks.  By ensuring that all students had engaged thoughtfully with the readings before coming to class, the class discussions we were able to have were at a much deeper level than is typical in a Yale course.  The group we built always felt very collaborative and collegial, and I loved coming to class each day.

Strength: seminar-based learning, great contents
Weaknesses: the level of knowledge in the class varies greatly

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student.  The course is not easy, but if you put in the effort, you will learn a LOT.  Prof. Stearns is an excellent teacher, and I always found class to be very enjoyable.  If you're in E&EB, this course is a must take.
Would recommend if you are interested in the topic! Professor Stearns is the expert in the field and he is happy to answer any questions you have
